item.title: How Long To Beat Ninja Gaiden 4? Game Length Explained
item.content:encoded:
Ninja Gaiden 4 is anything but a pushover. Team Ninja has once again concocted another brutal affair, sure to have you pulling out your hair for hours. If you’re wondering how many hours exactly, we can run through Ninja Gaiden 4’s game length and expected playtime for you.

Team Ninja finally returned to its legendary franchise after a few years away. Ninja Gaiden 4 carries on Ryu Hayabusa’s journey and brings back the PTSD instilled by over 30 years of almost hilariously difficult NG games. Don’t get it twisted, we welcome the challenge, and NG games offer a level of challenge not even some Souls games can match!

Ninja Gaiden 4 looks to be a violent return to form. If you’re curious as to how much content is in the game, we’ve got all the answers you need.

How Many Hours To Beat Ninja Gaiden 4?

Team Ninja Director Masakazu Hirayama has said an initial playthrough on normal difficulty should take you “15 to 20 hours.”

Firstly, Ninja Gaiden 4 on a ‘normal’ difficulty is the equivalent of other games essentially being on hard—on steroids. Your mileage will vary when it comes to Hirayama’s window—through NextPlay. If you’re well-versed in hack ‘n’ slash games and used to the difficulty of every combat encounter, then this is a realistic timeframe.

If you’re unfamiliar with Ninja Gaiden and intense action games such as these, your runtime might lean toward the 20-hour window, and beyond. Whereas if you make use of NG 4’s difficulty settings, you might even clock in at just under 15 hours!

There’s plenty of choice.

How Long is a Ninja Gaiden 4 Full Completionist Run?

A completionist run of Ninja Gaiden 4 could feasibly take you 50-100 hours-plus, and there’s a good chance that most people will never be able to complete Ninja Gaiden 4 at all!

If we’re talking about doing everything in Nnja Gaiden 4, this means beating all the extra Missions, Challenges, achieving full weapon mastery, and beating all difficulty levels.

The reason this can take upwards of 100 hours—borderline until the end of time itself—is because of Master Ninja mode. If you go through the full Ninja Gaiden 4 trophy list, you’ll see that “Way of the Master Ninja” requires you to “Complete the game on MASTER NINJA difficulty.”

If this is anything like previous games, expect enemies to kill you in barely any hits, insta-kill you with grab attacks, and attack you whilst you’re attacking other enemies—and even if you’re in the air! It’s beyond brutal. It’s sadistic, but a sickeningly good time for Ninja Gaiden enthusiasts.

Please, please let us know if you intend to do everything. Have you beaten any Ninja Gaiden games on Master Ninja difficulty (or the equivalent setting) in the past? Now’s the time to brag through the Insider Gaming Discord.

For even more Ninja Gaiden 4 coverage here at IG, check out its Early Access eligibility, and if it’s free to play on Xbox Game Pass.

item.title: All Pokémon Legends: Z-A Wild Zone 2 Spawns & Alpha Pokémon Locations
item.content:encoded:
There are plenty of Pokémon to encounter in Pokémon Legends: Z-A across Lumiose City, with Wild Zones having different spawns for Pokémon. For all the details on Wild Zone 2, we’ve got you covered.

Wild Zone 2 may be accessible very early in the story, but it’s well worth hunting for new additions to your party here as there are three Pokémon that can be evolved to unlock Mega Evolutions later on, so adding them to your ranks early on is advised to increase their levels in anticipation for battles.

If you’re on the hunt for a specific Pokémon, here are the details on everything you can find in Wild Zone 2 in Pokémon Legends: Z-A.

Wild Zone 2 in Pokémon Legends: Z-A is available to explore after you complete Main Mission 5, and is one of the earliest areas you will be able to explore.

There are six Pokémon species in total to find and catch to earn the golden crown for fully discovering the Pokémon in Wild Zone 2, earning a chunk of points towards Mable’s Research rewards.

The table below shows all Pokémon that spawn in Wild Zone 2, the time of day required, and notes on the specific location where they can be found.

There is one spawn point for Alpha Pokémon in Wild Zone 2, with the Pokémon that appears depending on the time of day.

The locked spawn point for the Alpha Pokémon is located on the right-hand side of the zone from the fast-travel point, accessible via stepping stones from the top-right of the zone.

Other Pokémon in Wild Zone 2 can spawn as Alpha Pokémon, however, as every spawn has a chance of appearing as an Alpha. However, there are guaranteed spawns that can be farmed for valuable resources like EXP Candies.

item.title: All Pokémon Legends: Z-A Wild Zone 1 Spawns & Alpha Pokémon Locations

Pokémon Legends: Z-A takes place entirely in Lumiose City, but that doesn’t mean there isn’t a ton to explore. Pokémon spawns are scattered in various Wild Zones, and we’ve got all the spawns and Alpha Pokémon in Wild Zone 1.

In total, Pokémon Legends: Z-A has 20 Wild Zones to explore, which unlock periodically at various points in the story, with Wild Zone 1 being just the tip of the iceberg. However, there are some handy Pokémon available in this spot that can be long-term inclusions in your party.

For all the full Pokémon spawns in Wild Zone 1, including the Alpha Pokémon available, look no further than this guide.

Wild Zone 1 is immediately available to access in Pokémon Legends: Z-A, serving as part of the introduction locations, and features several Pokémon.

In total, there are seven species of Pokémon to find and catch to complete Mable’s Research Task for Wild Zone 1, though not all of them will be available to encounter immediately as some story progression is required before you can fully explore the area.

The table below shows all Pokémon that spawn in Wild Zone 1, the time of day required, and notes on the specific location they can be found.

There is one locked Alpha Pokémon spawn in Wild Zone 1, which is fixed to always be present in the game. However, it won’t be the only Alpha you can encounter in this area.

Every Pokémon in Legends: Z-A has a chance of spawning as an Alpha, with only some having fixed and guaranteed spawns. Many of those rotate with several potential Pokémon, but this isn’t the case in Wild Zone 1.

item.title: All Games And Services Impacted By AWS Outage—Fortnite, Roblox, PlayStation Network & More
item.content:encoded:
Amazon Web Services is down, and with AWS suffering a network outage, this means many of the world’s leading games and services are inoperational. Let’s take a look at who’s affected and how long this could last.

AWS is Amazon‘s large cloud platform, consisting of many leading companies. Quite simply, if the whole network goes down, so does every service attached to the platform. As a result, many of you around the world are likely scrambling for answers as you attempt to whip up pictures on Canva or wonder what to do with your free time as Fortnite is down.

We’ve got a list of the major services affected by the AWS outage. Plus, information on what’s happening next.

Every Game & Service Hit By Amazon Web Services Outage

The list of services hit by the AWS problem includes Fortnite, Rocket League, Snapchat, Roblox, Canva, Wordle, Duloingo, amongst others.

Here’s the current list of major outages affected by the Amazon Web Services outage. We are trying to update the list for you so you can see if your favorite apps and games are down:

  • Amazon (Ring Doorbells)
  • Canva
  • Clash of Clans
  • Clash Royale
  • Coinbase
  • Duolingo
  • Epic Games
  • Fortnite
  • HMRC (UK Tax Site)
  • Life360
  • My Fitness Pal
  • Online Banking (Bank of Scotland, Halifax, Lloyds)
  • Peloton
  • PlayStation Network
  • PokemonGo
  • Roblox
  • Rocket League
  • Signal
  • Slack
  • Smartsheet
  • Snapchat
  • Wordle
  • Xero
  • Zoom

When Will All AWS Outage Be Fixed?

The BBC has been told that AWS has “Identified a potential root cause for error rates for the DynamoDB APIs in the US-EAST-1 Region. We are working on multiple parallel paths to accelerate recovery.”

There’s no telling how long this could be, though. It could be an hour, a few hours, a day, or even a week. No one really knows, and we’re keeping a close eye on AWS communications, the BBC, and any other source that has information tied to the outage.

Fingers crossed, we have some good news for you sooner or later, so keep checking back for news updates on the situation.

It’s not often some of the biggest games and services are offline simultaneously like this—such is the size and scope of AWS. Let us know of any other major companies or services you’ve noticed are being affected, which you can do by either leaving a comment below or going over to the Insider Gaming Discord.
